thread.title: Justin Timberlake Inducted Into Memphis Music Hall of Fame
thread.title_full: Justin Timberlake Inducted Into Memphis Music Hall of Fame

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Justin Timberlake Inducted Into Memphis Music Hall of Fame
text:
Comments The 'Social Network' actor gets emotional during his acceptance speech after an introduction by Jimmy Fallon. 
Justin Timberlake was feted at the Memphis Music Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony. The NSYNC star was introduced by best pal, Jimmy Fallon , at the Cannon Center on Saturday, October 17 in Memphis, Tennessee. The singer-turned-actor got emotional during his acceptance speech, "I am truly honored to be able to stand on the shoulders of all these legends that I grew up listening to and I grew up admiring to say that I stand alongside them now." "This is the f*cking coolest thing that has ever happened to me," he said. "The Grammys are political. The Emmys are political. Memphis is not political. And don't get me started on Hollywood." The Memphis-born musician also paid tribute to his root, "My favorite part about this city is we don't apologize for who we are, and that's who this city has taught me to be." Decked out in a Tom Ford suit, Timberlake collaborated with R&B icon Sam Moore on "Sittin' on the Dock of the Bay".
